page.title: 01SW corner Map Ref. 160020
page.content: This{Summer Wine Country}on the northern flanks of the upper Don Valley varies from 240m to 415m a.s.l. The lower and better quality land provides feed for cattle and sheep. The higher land is peat, moorland and poor grazing. The population of less than 1000 live in a number of scattered villages and farms. The main villages are Crowedge with about 100 dwellings, Carlecote with 30 and Townhead with 6 plus a{Commune}in two rows of old terraced houses of local blue brick which was once the main product of the internationally known firm of{Hepworth Iron Company}which now makes drainage pipes from local clay. Apart from the success of H.I.C. the amenities and population of the region have declined over the years with the loss of railways, churches, schools and housing.
